noun.description: The part of a theater, concert hall, or other public building in which the audience sits.
examples: the stage was small and the auditorium had only 366 seats

noun.description: A large building or hall used for public gatherings, typically speeches or stage performances.
examples: the National Indoor Arena is a magnificent auditorium and one of Britain's premier indoor venues

origin: Early 17th century (originally in the general sense a place for hearing): from Latin, neuter of auditorius relating to hearing (see auditory).
